title: Safe Haven Enterprise visa
summary: This page provides detailed information about the Safe Haven Enterprise visa (subclass 790), a temporary protection visa for people who arrived in Australia without a visa and are seeking asylum. It outlines eligibility, visa conditions, permitted activities, obligations, processing details, family inclusion rules, and travel restrictions.

structured_data.description: A temporary visa for people who arrived in Australia without a visa and want to seek asylum. Allows temporary stay if Australia’s protection obligations are engaged and other requirements are met.

processing_times.notes: Applications are complex and may take time. Timeliness depends on providing complete and accurate information.

with_this_visa_you_can: Stay in Australia temporarily for 5 years
Live, work and study in Australia
Access government services such as Workforce Australia, Medicare, and Centrelink
Access short-term counselling for torture and trauma when required
Attend free English language classes if eligible
Travel overseas to countries other than your home country with written approval for compassionate or compelling reasons

eligibility.protection_obligations: Must engage Australia’s protection obligations or be a member of the same family unit of someone who does
additional_requirements: Meet health, character, identity and security requirements
Sign a declaration stating intention to work or study in regional Australia
eligibility.arrival_conditions: Must have arrived in Australia without a valid visa or without being immigration cleared

application_rules.apply_from: Applicants and included family members must be in Australia when applying.

requirements: Family members must be in Australia
Family members must be eligible to apply for this visa

categories: Spouse or de facto partner of the family head
Dependent child or step-child of the family head
Dependent child or step-child of the family head's partner
Other dependent relatives of the family head

dependent_child_definition.age_requirements: Under 18, or 18+ if incapacitated for work or substantially reliant on parent/step-parent
dependent_child_definition.exclusions: Children of any age who are married, engaged, or in a de facto relationship

dependency_criteria: Must not have a spouse or de facto partner
Must usually live with the family head
Must be wholly or substantially reliant for financial, psychological, or physical support

newborn_child_rules.automatic_inclusion: Child born after application lodgement and before decision is automatically included in application
notification_requirements: Complete Form 1022 Notification of change of circumstances
Provide clear colour copy of birth certificate
Upload in ImmiAccount or send certified copy by post if posting
newborn_child_rules.citizenship_note: Child born in Australia receives same visa as parents unless one parent is an Australian citizen or permanent resident, in which case the child may be an Australian citizen by birth

stay_longer_information.rules_after_14_feb_2023: Must apply for a subsequent SHEV or TPV before the current visa expires if still needing protection and not barred.
stay_longer_information.rules_before_14_feb_2023: Eligible TPV/SHEV holders or former holders may apply for the permanent Resolution of Status (RoS) visa (subclass 851).

review_rights.notes: Refusal letter includes details and timeframes for review rights

travel_conditions.before_application_decision: Leaving Australia before decision causes bridging visa to expire and prevents re-entry.

visa_condition_8570.name: Restricted travel
restrictions: Cannot travel to home country under any circumstances
Can only enter other countries with written approval for compassionate or compelling reasons
Travelling without approval may result in cancellation of visa (and family members’ visas)

structured_data.visa_label: No physical label. Visa is digitally linked to travel document or ImmiCard.

consequences: May be prevented from applying for a SHEV or TPV again
Bridging visa expires 35 days after withdrawal
requirements_for_withdrawal: Must include full name, date of birth, and details of application
All additional applicants aged 18+ must sign or provide separate withdrawal letters
